intro: Spiraea japonica var. vulcanica, commonly known as the Japanese weeping spirea, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It is characterized by its cascading clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, arching branches that give it a weeping appearance, making it a popular ornamental plant. Its leaves are elliptical, dark green, and turn yellow in the fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
